snippet: Some experts fear that the United States’ reliance on imported enriched uranium may affect its global nonproliferation efforts and potentially cause supply problems in the future.
abstract: Some experts fear that the United States’ reliance on imported enriched uranium may affect its global nonproliferation efforts and potentially cause supply problems in the future; last American factory for enriching uranium closed in May, 2013.
lead_paragraph: Some experts fear that the United States’ reliance on imported enriched uranium may affect its global nonproliferation efforts and potentially cause supply problems in the future.

headline.main: Ebb in Uranium Enrichment in U.S. Raises Questions About Nuclear Policy
headline.print_headline: Ebb in Uranium Enrichment in U.S. Raises Questions About Nuclear Policy
